body_html:
I think so long as the amount of RAM allocated per CPU core isn't too low the scripts should work fine on most dev machines (albeit slowly).

The issue in my case is that the container was using just under 4 logical cores, but only had 2GB ram allocated, hence the memory issues. Now that I've allocated 4GB to docker, the container is only using ~2.2GB RAM.

It would make it easier to contribute to tensorflow if one could just test against the beefy CI servers with impunity, but it's also not a huge barrier.

Either way, the build and tests are now running properly, so I'll close the issue. Thanks again for your help, I really appreciate it.

body:
I think so long as the amount of RAM allocated per CPU core isn't too low the scripts should work fine on most dev machines (albeit slowly). 

The issue in my case is that the container was using just under 4 logical cores, but only had 2GB ram allocated, hence the memory issues. Now that I've allocated 4GB to docker, the container is only using ~2.2GB RAM. 

It would make it easier to contribute to tensorflow if one could just test against the beefy CI servers with impunity, but it's also not a huge barrier.

Either way, the build and tests are now running properly, so I'll close the issue. Thanks again for your help, I really appreciate it.
